column4: ok i'd like to clarify some things.  7.10 of ubuntu uses emerald as the default window manager and NOT metacity, correct?
wrong
it uses compiz if your comp supports it
emerald is not a window manager.  it is a window decorator for compiz.
there's also gtk-window-decorator that lets compiz use metacity themes

ok, i have a computer that doesn't support compiz.  and it's turned off completely.  the title bars from all windows disappear.  i found a fix (from this room) "metacity --replace" fixes it.  but it doesn't stick after reboot.
check system -> pref -> sessions and make sure its not trying to run compiz
ok hold on...
it doesn't look like it's trying to run compiz... i see metacity in the "current session" section... but where would i find it?
not current session. the startup
also go to system -> pref -> appearances and make sure desktop effects is disabled
i checked the second place already, desktop effects are disabled.  under startup there's just a thing that says "Visual: Autostart the preferred AT".  but nothing that's close to compiz
unless you need an on-screen keyboard due to a physical disability, you can disable that
ok... but compiz isn't listed.  so i just want the "metacity --replace" setting to stick after a reboot, because after i rebooted the titlebars disappeared again.
could add "metacity --replace" to the startup i suppose
i guess... i'd really rather know what the underlying problem is, and why that fixes it.
compiz is finding a way to run.  you could just uninstall it
i thought it was integrated into 7.10... can i just uninstall with synaptic?
yeah
so just as i would assume there is no way to uninstall compiz it seems... unless you have a way, it's certainly not listed in add/remove programs.  aptitude couldn't seem to find it either.
apt-cache search compiz
uh... ok?  is that just installed programs or all avaliable?
